SEARCH
Package net.elena.murat.shape

Class Cube

java.lang.Object
net.elena.murat.shape.Cube
All Implemented Interfaces:
EMShape
public class Cube extends Object implements EMShape
Represents a cube in the scene. It can be defined by a side length (centered at origin) or by two corner points. It implements EMShape to support transformations and materials.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Cube(double sideLength)
    Constructs a Cube with the given side length, centered at the origin in its local space.
    Cube(Point3 min, Point3 max)
    Constructs a Cube from two corner points in its local space.

  • Constructor Details

    • Cube

      public Cube(double sideLength)
      Constructs a Cube with the given side length, centered at the origin in its local space.
      Parameters:
      sideLength - The length of each side of the cube.

    • Cube

      public Cube(Point3 min, Point3 max)
      Constructs a Cube from two corner points in its local space. The cube will be axis-aligned within its local coordinate system.
      Parameters:
      min - The minimum corner of the cube (e.g., lower-left-back).
      max - The maximum corner of the cube (e.g., upper-right-front).

    • intersect

      public double intersect(Ray ray)
      Calculates the intersection of a ray with the cube. This method transforms the ray into the object's local space, performs the intersection test, and returns the 't' value.
      Specified by:
      intersect in interface EMShape
      Parameters:
      ray - The ray to intersect with the cube (in world coordinates).
      Returns:
      The distance 't' along the ray to the closest intersection point, or Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY if no intersection.

    • intersectAll

      public List<IntersectionInterval> intersectAll(Ray ray)
      Calculates all intersection intervals between a ray and this cube. Uses the slab method to find entry and exit points on the six faces.
      Specified by:
      intersectAll in interface EMShape
      Parameters:
      ray - The ray to test, in world coordinates.
      Returns:
      A list of IntersectionInterval objects. Empty if no intersection.

    • getNormalAt

      public Vector3 getNormalAt(Point3 worldPoint)
      Returns the surface normal at a given point on the cube's surface. The point is in world coordinates. The normal is calculated in local space and then transformed back to world space.
      Specified by:
      getNormalAt in interface EMShape
      Parameters:
      worldPoint - The point on the cube's surface in world coordinates.
      Returns:
      The normalized normal vector at that point in world coordinates.
